info.title: Site provider api
info.description:
Version 2.0 Of the Site Provider containers the re-engineering of the registration endpoints, introducing
dynamic schemas and PlayerRegistration objects.

### PlayerSchemas

Robust, fully dynamic datamodel and FormView templates for registration data, including extendable validator
logic.

For each portal, there can be multiple playerSchemas, although it is envisioned that all sites will have three:

* registrationFull
* registrationShort
* playerProfile

The schemas return datamodel and formview data for dynamic rendering of all forms, and include additional data
such as:

* HTML5 Hint: the suggested HTML5 control to use with the each field.
* FieldType: A logical field type, based on the DK formbuilder for handeling of specific types of fields, such as:
  * TAC
  * Country picker
  * Color chooser
  * Link

As well as other standard field types like date, datetime, etc.  

Field definitions provide information such as required status, JSON dataType, grouping information, and field order.

For select/multiselect/radio fields values valueLists, and default values are provided. These values are provided
only as "slugs" for the value portion of the controls, leaving localization up to the consumer. *This should be evaluated in next versions to see if this is the best way to handle localization*

#### Validators

Field validation logic is handled by returning an array of validators for each field. This will allow consumers, if they wish, to implement the same JavaScript validators that are used on the back end. If not desired, validators 
return slugs of their names for localization. A validator description is also provided for developer use.

PlayerRegistration.description:
Object for submitting player registration data. Since player registration data is dynamic, and based on
dynamic schemas, with dynamic value types, registration data is submitted using an object which contains
arrays of the 4 possible value types; strings, numbers, arrays and Objects. This combination of field
name, type and value is termed a FieldInstance.

PlayerSchema.description: Player Schemas are both data models and form views for player data on the Gaming Portal. PlayerSchemas are used both in the registration process as well as in the Player Profile. A PlayerSchema is identified by a name and a unique code, and contains an array of fields.

schemaName.description: A human readable description of the player schema object.

fields.description: An array of the fields used in the

SchemaCode.description: Short code for the player schema

Field.description: Base definition of a field, which is then either a FieldInstance, or a FieldDefinition.

FieldInstance.description: Base field instance, for which all field instance types are desendant.

FieldInstanceStr.description: Field instance for field values which are strings

FieldInstanceNum.description: Field instance for field values which are numbers

FieldInstanceArr.description: Field instance for field values which are arrays

FieldInstanceObj.description: Field instance for field values which are objects.

name.description: human readable name of the field

fieldType.description: The field type. One of the supported field types. Some field types have special handling and purpose. For example; the TAC type is a special field for Terms and Conditions.

HTML5Hint.description: A hint to the preffered HTML5 input widget to use for this field.

group.description: the group that the field belongs to

defaultValue.description: The default value "slug" for a dropdown or multiselect type (only)

DataType.description: The JSON data type expected by the system.

order.description: The suggested order of the item

value.description: The value of the dropdown value. This is not the value (usually) to display on the UI, rather it is the "slug" used for the value, what should be retured to the system. Always is returned as string so check the isNumber value to see if you should cast to number.

isNumber.description: Since we always return DD values as strings, use this to cast the values to number if required.

Validators.description: A validator with order, as returned with other validators.

order.description: The order in which the validator is applied.

Validator.description: The definition of a field validator.

code.description: Seven charactar (UPPER CASE), unique short code idenfifying the validator

description.description: A developers description of what the validator validates, not for use on the UI.

invalidSlug.description: The slug that will be returned upon invalidation.

validSlug.description: THe slug that will be returned when valid. (Usually not present/used.)

Info.description: Response information, anything that is not response data itself.

pageNum.description: The current page number, 0 if no pages

pages.description: The total number of pages, 0 if not paged.

pageSize.description: The size of each page, 0 if no paging.
